body:
Fix from #4784 (wrt `List`s) might be useful.

**EDIT**: indeed, just needed to apply same logic (removal of check) from `Collection` case.

Fixing for 2.18, to be released in 2.18.3.

rename.from: Wrong behavior of @JsonMerge with a Map

body: Thanks. So does `@JsonMerge` go on the field or the getter, or whichever is configured to be used?
@nlisker Should make no difference, both should work. I tend to add to getter personally fwtw. :)

issue.title: WebFlux decodes wildcard content-types as form-data/multipart

labels.name: in: web
labels.description: Issues in web modules (web, webmvc, webflux, websocket)

issue.body:
<!--

Have you considered asking for help on stackoverflow.com?

** Bug Reports **
Please submit issues against OSS supported versions, see https://spring.io/projects/spring-framework#support
Please provide a minimal sample application that reproduces the problem for faster issue triage.

** Enhancements requests **
Before explaining how you would like things to work,
please describe a concrete use case for this feature and how you have tried to solve this so far.

-->

## Bug description

I'm having an issue with form data when using content type */*. I managed to pinpoint it to [this](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/4922) fix on Jackson Databind.
What happens now when initializing form data in DefaultServerWebExchange ([code](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/main/spring-web/src/main/java/org/springframework/web/server/adapter/DefaultServerWebExchange.java#L154)) is that JSON mappers also say they can read form data ([here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/main/spring-web/src/main/java/org/springframework/web/server/adapter/DefaultServerWebExchange.java#L200-L204)) and parsing therefore fails (because they can't).
Before this Jackson fix, ObjectMapper answered that it couldn't deserialize MultiValueMap.

## Bug reproduce
Here is the simplest dummy app I've managed to build which replicates the issue: [https://github.com/Dodomix/form-data-jackson-bug](https://github.com/Dodomix/form-data-jackson-bug). The test fails with version 3.4.4 of Spring Boot, and passes with 3.4.3 (change in Jackson 2.18.2 -> 2.18.3). I'm opening the report here because the problematic code is in spring-web.

The exact behavior which changed in Jackson:
```
var objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();
objectMapper.canDeserialize(objectMapper.constructType(MultiValueMap.class));
```

## Expected behavior
All tests pass.

## System info
Java: Temurin 24
